title: First Conditional vs. Second Conditional Quiz

questions.prompt: Complete the sentence: 'If it _______ (rain) tomorrow, we _______ (stay) at home.'
Complete the sentence: 'If I _______ (win) the lottery, I _______ (buy) a new car.'
Complete the sentence: 'If she _______ (study) hard, she _______ (pass) the exam.'
Complete the sentence: 'If they _______ (arrive) late, we _______ (start) the meeting without them.'
Complete the sentence: 'If you _______ (practice) more, you _______ (improve) your skills.'
Complete the sentence: 'If he _______ (miss) the bus, he _______ (be) late for work.'
Complete the sentence: 'If we _______ (not find) the keys, we _______ (have to) call a locksmith.'
Complete the sentence: 'If she _______ (not come) to the party, I _______ (be) disappointed.'
Complete the sentence: 'If he _______ (get) the job, he _______ (start) next Monday.'
Complete the sentence: 'If it _______ (snow) tomorrow, we _______ (build) a snowman.'
Choose the correct option: 'If I _______ (have) enough money, I _______ (travel) around the world.'
Choose the correct option: 'If she _______ (not finish) her work on time, she _______ (get) into trouble.'
Choose the correct option: 'If we _______ (not take) the train, we _______ (have) to walk.'
Choose the correct option: 'If he _______ (not arrive) soon, we _______ (start) the meeting without him.'
Choose the correct option: 'If you _______ (not study) for the exam, you _______ (fail) it.'
